Problem:
Analyze the behavior of a complex-valued function \\(z(t) = e^{i\omega t}u(t)\\) where \\(\omega\\) is a real constant and \\(u(t)\\) obeys the differential equation \\(\dot{u} = Ku\\), with K being a constant complex matrix.

If the transformation \\( h(z) = e^{Lt}z \\) (where L is a constant matrix) is applied to \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\( \dot{u} = Ku \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) was directly evolved to t = T under \\( \dot{u} = Ku \\)?
Explanation: Applying the transformation \\( h(z) \\) alters the initial condition of the system, as \\( e^{Lt} \\) modifies the magnitude and phase components of \\(z(t)\\). These changes affect how \\( e^{i\omega t} \\) interacts with \\( u(t) \\), thus the trajectory of the system is altered, resulting in a different state at time T.
